meta.title: From LOCKED to ROOM
meta.author: Sandy Weisz and Mao Reynolds
meta.message: This week’s Raddles unpack common tropes in crime fiction. In locked-room mysteries, there’s no clear way that the culprit could have entered the scene, killed and left. The first in this genre is generally considered to be Edgar Allan Poe’s “The Murders in the Rue Morgue,” published in 1841.
